name: Basketball
description: A team sport played by two teams of five players on a rectangular court.

name: Soccer
description: The world's most popular sport. Two teams compete to score goals by getting the ball into the opposing net.

name: Cricket
description: A bat-and-ball game played between two teams of eleven players on a field.

name: Tennis
description: A racquet sport that can be played individually against a single opponent or between two teams of two players.

name: Table Tennis
description: A fast-paced indoor racquet sport played on a hard table divided by a net.

name: Swimming
description: A sport that involves moving through water using the limbs.

name: Rowing
description: A sport in which athletes race boats using oars on water.

name: Cycling
description: Competitive cycling includes different disciplines, such as road racing and track racing.

name: Boxing
description: A combat sport where two people throw punches at each other for a predetermined set of time in a boxing ring.

name: Rugby
description: A contact team sport which originated in England, with two teams competing to score tries.

name: Lacrosse
description: A team sport played with a small rubber ball and a long-handled stick called a crosse or lacrosse stick.

name: Badminton
description: A racquet sport played using racquets to hit a shuttlecock across a net.

name: Surfing
description: A surface water sport in which the wave rider rides on the forward or deep face of a moving wave.

name: Gymnastics
description: A sport that includes exercises requiring balance, strength, flexibility, agility, coordination and endurance.

name: Archery
description: The sport, practice, or skill of using a bow to shoot arrows at a target.
